intro: Senecio solidaginoides, commonly known as the yellow starbursh, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Senecio solidaginoides is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
